intro: Mimulus depressus var. nanus, commonly known as the dwarf yellow monkeyflower, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the western United States. It features small, vibrant yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically reaches a height of only a few inches, making it ideal for rock gardens or as a ground cover. Its leaves are ovate and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, showcasing its adaptability to diverse environments.
